title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 § 298.2 - Joint collection and enforcement activity by the department

N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 § 298.2 - Joint collection and enforcement activity by the department

State Regulations

Administrative Code of the City of New York, § 11-1943; Tax

Law, § 1311(b), (d) and (c)
(a) If the
department takes any collection or enforcement action under article 22 of the

Tax Law, chapter 17 of title 11 of the Administrative Code of the City of New

York, or article IX or X of the Codes and Ordinances of the City of Yonkers, the department shall, whenever feasible or possible, in its discretion, accompany such action with similar action under the enforcement and collection
provisions of chapter 19 of title 11 of the Administrative Code of the City of

New York. (b) Whenever the
department takes any action with respect to a deficiency of tax pursuant to
article 22 of the Tax Law, chapter 17 of title 11 of the Administrative Code of
the City of New York, or article IX or X of the Codes and Ordinances of the

City of Yonkers, other than the action set forth in section
298.1
of this Part, the department may, in its discretion, accompany such action with
similar action under chapter 19 of title 11 of the Administrative Code of the

City of New York. (c) Whenever the
department shall take any joint action, any and all moneys collected as a
result of such joint action or actions by the department shall be deemed to
have been collected in proportion to the amount of such taxes due, including
tax, interest, penalties and additions to tax. For the rate of interest on
overpayments, underpayments and recovery of erroneous refunds, see Part 2393 of
this Title. Notes
